content:
Lets me make this very clear right now so there is no ongoing misunderstanding or wrong expectations.

This is a peer support forum. Folk here are fellow Thunderbird users. There are no folk that you get to heap abuse of that are paid to make you feel good about the product. We use it and generally like it, but that is about it.

Personally after more than a decade of responding to folk about not getting mail the forums are full of folk being told to look at their antivirus post upgrade and being asked for actual information about what error messages they get and what provider they use. You can not do more than guess what an issue is without information.

Have you tried any of the information in the appropriate support document. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/cannot-receive-messages which discusses this extremely generic issue. "I am not getting messages" is the electronic equivalent of the "postal service did not deliver a letter today" the reasons why that may be are myriad and certainly may exceed the number of minutes in the day the delivery failed.

The fundamental most common cause of mail receipt issues post an upgrade to Thunderbird is the software firewall on your antivirus product or one of the components of same that they inject into the running Thunderbird instance. It is difficult to build in reliability when external forces think they know better. Generally you do not see support articles directly blaming these products, even if such blame is earned. Then we have user resistance to the issue being anything but Thunderbird. It is the product that is not working, so of course it needs to be fixed. usually nothing is further from the truth.

So I will leave you with the standard "boiler plate" request for information since you did not include anything relevant to actually trying to help you with your issue.

Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  3. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
  4. Please also provide results for the following test on your system
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking.

Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hello there We have read the message We try to help

There is a common way to change these values for mac or windows. what is the type of PC that you have?

Text forum :

Go to the menu bar, select Thunderbird > Preferences (Mac) or Tools > Options (Windows PC). Then click display.

Select the default font and size you prefer to change colors, select Colors. When you're happy with your choices, select OK.

Important is : Clear the Allow messages to use other fonts check box so that your choices override those of senders.



Greetings Firefox volunteer.

Works on every version of Thunderbird



Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: googlethunderbird

content: Settings/General/Language & Appearance/Fonts & Colours, Advanced... set the fonts and sizes with Fonts for: Latin and repeat with Fonts for: Other Writing Systems. Uncheck 'Allow messages...'.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Lowell Simon said
I have two accounts and the SMTP user names each match.

Not according to your mail provider they do not. THat is exactly what that error message they are sending you says. They do not match.

Goto the outgoing server (SMTP) in account settings and make sure you have two entries there with clear and distinct names. NO RoadRunner repeated etc.

Now go to the incoming accounts and confirm that the associated SMTP server for each identity is actually the ones for each identity you think they are.

Now go to one of the mails that you replied to and click reply again. Is the from information on the reply what you expect. Thunderbird has some odd rules about what SMTP account to use, and my feeling is any use of unified folders sees the "default" SMTP server selected for replies. But I might be wrong. But again confirmation please.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I have two accounts and the SMTP user names each match.

content:
Start Profile Manager by opening a Run window (Winkey+R) and entering

thunderbird.exe -p

Create a new profile, add an account (preferably IMAP), and see if it works properly. If it does, you can add more accounts and transfer data from the old profile to the new one. This isn't a solution, just a temporary measure to try and restore normal operations.

content:
Spectrum/TWC settings are hard to pin down. I think the server should be mail.twc.com, according to Spectrum.

Try these settings: mail.twc.com on port 587, STARTTLS security, normal password, User Name = email address. If that doesn't work, try the same but with SSL/TLS security (choose the security, then type in 587).

In the event that Bitdefender is interfering, I suggest running Windows in safe mode to bypass startup apps ('disabling' BD not sufficient).
creator: sfhowes

content:
Global Inbox is only for POP accounts. For IMAP, or a mix of POP and IMAP, use Unified Folders.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Global_Inbox
